intro: Dimerostemma bahiense, commonly known as the Bahamian star vine, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale green. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, often with a slight pubescence. Dimerostemma bahiense is adapted to coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
